snippet: Labor groups reported that vocational students were being forced to work at plants making iPhones as “interns.”
abstract: Foxconn Technology, Apple's manufacturing partner in China, is coming under renewed criticism over labor practices after reports that vocational students are being compelled to work at plants making iPhones and their components; Foxconn acknowledges using student 'interns' on manufacturing lines, but says they are free to leave at any time.

byline.original: By DAVID BARBOZA and CHARLES DUHIGG
byline.contributor: Charles Duhigg reported from New York.

lead_paragraph: Labor groups reported that vocational students were being forced to work at plants making iPhones as “interns.”

headline.seo: Foxconn Said to Use Forced Student Labor to Make iPhones
headline.main: China Contractor Again Faces Labor Issue on iPhones
headline.print_headline: China Plant Again Faces Labor Issue On iPhones
